Comment_contributor: (borrowed from Shipibo-Konibo that in turn borrowed it from Quechua, maybe through Ashaninka // This numeral is barely used in my database)

(this word seems to be historically related to hand, but synchronically it is not; a different word ‘meken’ is used for hand // This numeral is barely used and it seems to be a neologism recently introduced by school teachers)
(compound consisting of the words for 2 nd 5) Numbers do not go above 11.
